info.name: Research Briefing Server
info.description: API collection for the Research Briefing Server - an HTTP server exposing research tools with Bearer token authentication.

request.description: Check if the server is running. No authentication required.
List all available tools with their input schemas.

response.name: Success
response.body: [{"name":"search_web","description":"Search the web for a given query and return top results","inputSchema":{"type":"object","properties":{"query":{"type":"string"},"k":{"type":"integer","default":5}},"required":["query"]}}]

request.description:
Search the web using Google Custom Search API.

Parameters:
- query (required): Search query string
- k (optional): Number of results to return (default: 5, max: 10)

Fetch a URL and extract the main readable content using Mozilla Readability.

Parameters:
- url (required): URL to fetch and extract content from

Returns cleaned text content limited to 15,000 characters.

Summarize documents into exactly 5 bullet points with inline citations using local LLM (Ollama).

Parameters:
- topic (required): Topic being summarized
- docs (required): Array of documents with title, url, and text

Each bullet is limited to 200 characters and includes citation markers like [1], [2].

response.name: Success
response.body: {"bullets":["Solar energy capacity grew 25% in 2024 [1]","Offshore wind farms expanding with 15MW turbines [2]","US, China, and Europe lead solar installations [1]","UK and Denmark lead offshore wind development [2]","Renewable energy becoming increasingly competitive [1][2]"],"sources":[{"i":1,"title":"Solar Energy Growth Report","url":"https://example.com/solar"},{"i":2,"title":"Wind Power Advances","url":"https://example.com/wind"}]}

response.name: Ollama Not Running
response.body: {"error":"Ollama API error: 500. Is Ollama running with model \"llama3\"?"}

request.description:
Save markdown content to a file.

Parameters:
- filename (required): Filename for the markdown file (extension added automatically)
- content (required): Markdown content to save

Files are saved to the OUTPUT_DIR configured in .env (default: ./briefs)
